required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of CB-183,315 in Participants With Clostridium Difficile Associated Diarrhea (MK-4261-006)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blinded, Active-Controlled Study of CB-183,315 in Patients With Clostridium Difficile Associated Diarrhea

brief_summary.textblock: A total of 608 participants with Clostridium Difficile Associated Diarrhea (CDAD) will participate in this study; participants will receive either oral vancomycin or CB-183,315 in a blinded fashion. Treatment will last for 10 days and participants will be followed up for at least 40 days and a maximum of 100 days. The purpose of this study is to evaluate how well CB-183,315 treats CDAD as compared to vancomycin.

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Percentage of Participants Meeting Clinical Response Criteria for Cure at End of Treatment (EOT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after EOT (up to Day 13)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants considered "cured" (i.e., ≤2 loose stools per 24 hour period for at least 2 consecutive days and no need for additional antibiotics during the 3 days following EOT) was determined in the mMITT population. A CDAD diagnosis was defined as: 1) diarrhea with a minimum of 3 unformed bowel movements (UBM) or >200 mL volume of stool for participants with a collection device (e.g., rectal tube or colostomy bag) over 24 hours; and 2) a positive result for Clostridium difficile toxin by enzyme immunoassay (EIA), polymerase chain reaction (PCR), or a cell culture cytotoxin neutralization assay. Percentages were first stratified according to age (<75 or ≥75 years) and number of previous CDAD episodes (0 or ≥1) and constructed using Mehrotra-Railkar continuity-corrected minimum-risk stratum weights, and the weighted averages were then derived across strata in order to calculate the adjusted percentage.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing an Adverse Event (AE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after EOT (up to Day 40)
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Discontinuing From Study Treatment Due to an AE
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Clinical Failure Events up to Day 40
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 days after EOT (up to Day 40)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of clinical failure events, which included treatment failure, CDAD recurrence, death, or being lost to follow-up, occurring during each time period was determined in each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Percentage of Participants With Sustained Clinical Response at End of Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 40 days after EOT (up to Day 50)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with sustained clinical response was determined for each arm. Sustained clinical response was declared when participants had a clinical outcome of cure at EOT, did not experience any CDAD recurrence, did not die, were not lost to follow-up, and did not have the end of study visit prior to Day 40. Percentages were first stratified according to age (<75 or ≥75 years) and number of previous CDAD episodes (0 or ≥1) and constructed using Mehrotra-Railkar continuity-corrected minimum-risk stratum weights, and the weighted averages were then derived across strata in order to calculate the adjusted percentage.

arm_group.description: Participants took CB-183,315 250 mg twice daily (b.i.d.) and placebo capsules b.i.d. by mouth for 10 days.
Participants took vancomycin 125 mg four times daily (q.i.d.) by mouth for 10 days.

intervention.description: CB-183,315 250 mg white coated tablet over-encapsulated in a size 00 opaque hard gelatin capsule.
Vancomycin hydrochloride 125 mg capsule over-encapsulated in size 00 opaque hard gelatin capsule.
Placebo size 00 opaque hard gelatin capsules.

results_reference.citation: Daley P, Louie T, Lutz JE, Khanna S, Stoutenburgh U, Jin M, Adedoyin A, Chesnel L, Guris D, Larson KB, Murata Y. Surotomycin versus vancomycin in adults with Clostridium difficile infection: primary clinical outcomes from the second pivotal, randomized, double-blind, Phase 3 trial. J Antimicrob Chemother. 2017 Dec 1;72(12):3462-3470. doi: 10.1093/jac/dkx299.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study enrolled adult participants with Clostridium Difficile associated diarrhea (CDAD) at 104 study centers in North America, Asia-Pacific, and South America.

group.title: CB-183,315
group.description: Participants took CB-183,315 250 mg twice daily (b.i.d.) and placebo b.i.d. by mouth for 10 days.

group.title: Vancomycin
group.description: Participants took vancomycin 125 mg four times daily (q.i.d.) by mouth for 10 days.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Assigned to CB but received vancomycin

baseline.population: The baseline analysis population includes all randomized and treated participants with a confirmed CDAD diagnosis (microbiological modified intent-to-treat [mMITT] population).

group.title: CB-183,315
group.description: Participants took CB-183,315 250 mg b.i.d. and placebo b.i.d. by mouth for 10 days.

group.title: Vancomycin
group.description: Participants took vancomycin 125 mg q.i.d. by mouth for 10 days.

outcome.title: Adjusted Percentage of Participants Meeting Clinical Response Criteria for Cure at End of Treatment (EOT)
outcome.description: The percentage of participants considered "cured" (i.e., ≤2 loose stools per 24 hour period for at least 2 consecutive days and no need for additional antibiotics during the 3 days following EOT) was determined in the mMITT population. A CDAD diagnosis was defined as: 1) diarrhea with a minimum of 3 unformed bowel movements (UBM) or >200 mL volume of stool for participants with a collection device (e.g., rectal tube or colostomy bag) over 24 hours; and 2) a positive result for Clostridium difficile toxin by enzyme immunoassay (EIA), polymerase chain reaction (PCR), or a cell culture cytotoxin neutralization assay. Percentages were first stratified according to age (<75 or ≥75 years) and number of previous CDAD episodes (0 or ≥1) and constructed using Mehrotra-Railkar continuity-corrected minimum-risk stratum weights, and the weighted averages were then derived across strata in order to calculate the adjusted percentage.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 days after EOT (up to Day 13)
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized and treated participants with a confirmed CDAD diagnosis (mMITT population).

group.description: Participants took CB-183,315 250 mg b.i.d. and placebo b.i.d. by mouth for 10 days.

group.title: Vancomycin
group.description: Participants took vancomycin 125 mg q.i.d. by mouth for 10 days.

measure.title: Adjusted Percentage of Participants Meeting Clinical Response Criteria for Cure at End of Treatment (EOT)
measure.description: The percentage of participants considered "cured" (i.e., ≤2 loose stools per 24 hour period for at least 2 consecutive days and no need for additional antibiotics during the 3 days following EOT) was determined in the mMITT population. A CDAD diagnosis was defined as: 1) diarrhea with a minimum of 3 unformed bowel movements (UBM) or >200 mL volume of stool for participants with a collection device (e.g., rectal tube or colostomy bag) over 24 hours; and 2) a positive result for Clostridium difficile toxin by enzyme immunoassay (EIA), polymerase chain reaction (PCR), or a cell culture cytotoxin neutralization assay. Percentages were first stratified according to age (<75 or ≥75 years) and number of previous CDAD episodes (0 or ≥1) and constructed using Mehrotra-Railkar continuity-corrected minimum-risk stratum weights, and the weighted averages were then derived across strata in order to calculate the adjusted percentage.
measure.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized and treated participants with a confirmed CDAD diagnosis (mMITT population).

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was declared when the lower bound of the 95% CI for the difference in adjusted percentage of cured subjects was > -10%.

outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized and treated participants with a confirmed CDAD diagnosis (mMITT population).

outcome.title: Adjusted Percentage of Participants With Sustained Clinical Response at End of Study
outcome.description: The percentage of participants with sustained clinical response was determined for each arm. Sustained clinical response was declared when participants had a clinical outcome of cure at EOT, did not experience any CDAD recurrence, did not die, were not lost to follow-up, and did not have the end of study visit prior to Day 40. Percentages were first stratified according to age (<75 or ≥75 years) and number of previous CDAD episodes (0 or ≥1) and constructed using Mehrotra-Railkar continuity-corrected minimum-risk stratum weights, and the weighted averages were then derived across strata in order to calculate the adjusted percentage.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 40 days after EOT (up to Day 50)
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized and treated participants with a confirmed CDAD diagnosis (mMITT population).

measure.title: Adjusted Percentage of Participants With Sustained Clinical Response at End of Study
measure.description: The percentage of participants with sustained clinical response was determined for each arm. Sustained clinical response was declared when participants had a clinical outcome of cure at EOT, did not experience any CDAD recurrence, did not die, were not lost to follow-up, and did not have the end of study visit prior to Day 40. Percentages were first stratified according to age (<75 or ≥75 years) and number of previous CDAD episodes (0 or ≥1) and constructed using Mehrotra-Railkar continuity-corrected minimum-risk stratum weights, and the weighted averages were then derived across strata in order to calculate the adjusted percentage.
measure.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized and treated participants with a confirmed CDAD diagnosis (mMITT population).

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Superiority was declared if the lower bound of the 95% CI of the adjusted difference in sustained response was > 0.

reported_events.time_frame: All AEs were collected up to Day 13; only serious AEs (SAEs) and drug-related AEs were collected up to Day 50.
reported_events.desc: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study drug.

event.sub_title: Infective exacerbation of chronic obstructive airways disease

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
